overview_of_class:
This course is conducted completely online. The course is an introduction of human anatomical form and organization. Body structure will be studied with a regional approach and will involve a primarily gross anatomical study with supplementary histological and clinical material where relevant. Form-function relationships will be emphasized. Topics covered will include: anatomical terminology, cells and tissues, and the integumentary, skeletal, muscular, nervous, endocrine, cardiovascular, lymphatic/immune, respiratory, digestive, urinary, and reproductive systems. The systems will be covered as they are encountered in the regional approach. Readings are assigned from the Marieb, Wilhelm and Mallatt text.

This course will be conducted completely online. A technology fee will be added to tuition. There will be optional online office hours on Thursdays from 6:15-9:15 pm.
name: Human Anatomy
subject: BIOL_SCI
